intro: Hemigraphis, commonly known as "mosquito plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their striking, colorful foliage, often featuring contrasting leaf patterns and vibrant hues. Many species are cultivated as ornamental plants due to their aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Hemigraphis species typically have small, tubular flowers that are usually clustered in inflorescences.
